**Gray dragon scales** are a type of [body armor](/wiki/Body_armor "Body armor") that appear in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. They are made of [dragon hide](/wiki/Dragon_hide "Dragon hide") like all [dragon scales](/wiki/Dragon_scales "Dragon scales").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [5.2 SporkHack](#SporkHack)
  - [5.3 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [5.4 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [5.5 FIQHack](#FIQHack)

- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

Gray dragon scales are not randomly generated, though they can be [wished](/wiki/Wish "Wish") for or found in [bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones").

A [gray dragon](/wiki/Gray_dragon "Gray dragon") that leaves a [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") behind on death (i.e. always, unless killed by [disintegration](/wiki/Disintegration "Disintegration")) have a 1⁄3 chance of leaving behind dragon scales, while a dragon revived by the [wand of undead turning](/wiki/Wand_of_undead_turning "Wand of undead turning") or [spell of turn undead](/wiki/Spell_of_turn_undead "Spell of turn undead") only has a 1⁄20 chance to leave behind scales.[\[1\]](#cite_note-scalegen-1) Gray dragon scales dropped this way are always generated +0 and uncursed.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

## Description

While worn, gray dragon scales confer 3 base [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") and [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance"). Reading a non-cursed [scroll of enchant armor](/wiki/Scroll_of_enchant_armor "Scroll of enchant armor") that targets worn gray dragon scales will convert them into [gray dragon scale mail](/wiki/Gray_dragon_scale_mail "Gray dragon scale mail"), with a blessed scroll adding a point of [enchantment](/wiki/Enchantment "Enchantment").

Uncontrolled [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") while wearing gray dragon scales will turn the wearer into a gray dragon, and doing so while wearing the scale mail will additionally revert them to scales[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)[\[5\]](#cite_note-5) - in practice, only [quaffing](/wiki/Quaff "Quaff") a [potion of polymorph](/wiki/Potion_of_polymorph "Potion of polymorph") or [zapping](/wiki/Zapping "Zapping") a [wand of polymorph](/wiki/Wand_of_polymorph "Wand of polymorph") at yourself will do this.

## Strategy

- *Main article: [Dragon scales#Strategy](/wiki/Dragon_scales#Strategy "Dragon scales")*

Gray dragon scales are one of the two most coveted types, with the other being [silver dragon scales](/wiki/Silver_dragon_scales "Silver dragon scales"), and both are used to create what is generally considered the best form of body armor available. Most characters will prefer either type for their dragon mail, though there are other instances where another color may be sought out - for details on what makes gray the most preferable color for a given character, see the [strategy section](/wiki/Gray_dragon_scale_mail#Strategy "Gray dragon scale mail") of the article on gray dragon scale mail.

## History

Gray dragon scale mail first appears with most other colors of dragon scale mail in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0"). From NetHack 3.0.0 to [NetHack 3.0.10](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.10 "NetHack 3.0.10"), including variants based on those versions, gray dragon scale mail is created by polymorphing the corpse of a gray dragon. Gray dragon scales are introduced in [NetHack 3.1.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.0 "NetHack 3.1.0"), along with the current method for converting them into dragon scale mail.

## Variants

- *Main article: [Dragon-scaled armor](/wiki/Dragon-scaled_armor "Dragon-scaled armor")*

In some variants, dragon scale mail is phased out in favor of dragon-scaled armor, whose implementation is based on a proposal by dtsund. Instead of being made into mail of its own, dragon scales are treated as a [cloak](/wiki/Cloak "Cloak"), and reading a scroll of enchant armor melds them onto a worn set of body armor, generally augmenting that armor by adding its AC and conferred extrinsic properties to it. Dragon-scaled armor is implemented in [NetHack Fourk](/wiki/NetHack_Fourk "NetHack Fourk"), [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM").

Some variants also give gray dragon scale mail additional properties while worn, and may even introduce other forms of gray dragon scale armor - due to already being a powerful item, they may be less commonly given properties compared to other colors. Variants that implement partial intrinsics and/or [object properties](/wiki/Object_properties "Object properties") may also make other colors of dragon mail more worthwhile.

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), the [Lawful Quest](/wiki/Lawful_Quest "Lawful Quest") has a set of cursed -9 gray dragon scales among the items piled on the same square as a [statue trap](/wiki/Statue_trap "Statue trap") of an [arch-lich](/wiki/Arch-lich "Arch-lich").

### SporkHack

In [SporkHack](/wiki/SporkHack "SporkHack"), gray dragon scales are one of the few sets of dragon scales to not confer additional properties while worn.

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), dragon scales and dragon scale mail have randomized powers and [appearances](/wiki/Randomized_appearance "Randomized appearance") in each game - to [wish](/wiki/Wish "Wish") for dragon armor or scales by its corresponding power, either type of armor must be formally identified first, e.g. by using a [scroll of identify](/wiki/Scroll_of_identify "Scroll of identify") on dropped dragon scales (which identifies the matching scale mail along with it) or by witnessing the dragon use its breath weapon.

Gray dragon scales are effectively replaced by **magic dragon scales**, which confer only 1 base AC like all dragon scales in UnNetHack.

### dNetHack

- *Main article: [Dragon armor (dNetHack)](/wiki/Dragon_armor_\(dNetHack\) "Dragon armor (dNetHack)")*

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"), worn gray dragon scales additionally confer [half spell damage](/wiki/Half_spell_damage "Half spell damage").

[The Steel Scales of Kurtulmak](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#The_Steel_Scales_of_Kurtulmak "DNetHack artifacts") are a [lawful](/wiki/Lawful "Lawful") [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") set of grey dragon scales that serve as the [crowning](/wiki/Crowning "Crowning") gift for lawful [gnomes](/wiki/Gnome_\(starting_race\) "Gnome (starting race)"): they favor [kobolds](/index.php?title=Kobold_\(monster_attribute\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Kobold (monster attribute) (page does not exist)"), thus blasting any gnomish character they are gifted to (as well as any character not in kobold form), and have a base [material](/wiki/Object_materials_\(dNetHack\) "Object materials (dNetHack)") of [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron") instead of dragonhide. While worn, The Steel Scales of Kurtulmak grant [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection") and [half physical damage](/wiki/Half_physical_damage "Half physical damage"), in addition to the magic resistance and half spell damage of the base item, and penalize spellcasting due to their material; they weigh 300 aum, and can be made into dragon scale mail or a shield as normal. If The Steel Scales are gifted via crowning, the [riding](/wiki/Riding "Riding") skill is unrestricted to Expert level.

### FIQHack

In [FIQHack](/wiki/FIQHack "FIQHack"), gray dragon scales are one of the few sets of dragon scales to not confer additional properties while worn, as in SporkHack. They also weigh 300 aum like all dragon scales in FIQHack (which is halved while worn).

3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/polyself.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 498](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/polyself.c#L498)
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [src/polyself.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 501](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/polyself.c#L501)

Main article: Dragon scales#Strategy

Gray dragon scales are introduced in NetHack 3.1.0, along with the current method for converting them into dragon scale mail.

SLASH'EM
